00068 void TSquare::initClass()
00069 {
00070         SO_NODE_INIT_CLASS(TSquare, TShape, "TShape");
00071 }

00073 TSquare::TSquare( )
00074 {
00075         SO_NODE_CONSTRUCTOR(TSquare);
00076         SO_NODE_ADD_FIELD(m_sideLength, (10.0));
00077 }

00083 
00084 void TSquare::generatePrimitives(SoAction *action)
00085 {
00086     SoPrimitiveVertex   pv;
00087 
00088     // Access the state from the action.
00089     SoState  *state = action->getState();
00090    
00091     // See if we have to use a texture coordinate function,
00092     // rather than generating explicit texture coordinates.
00093     SbBool useTexFunc = ( SoTextureCoordinateElement::getType(state) ==
00094                           SoTextureCoordinateElement::FUNCTION );
00095                          
00096     // If we need to generate texture coordinates with a
00097     // function, we'll need an SoGLTextureCoordinateElement.
00098     // Otherwise, we'll set up the coordinates directly.
00099     const SoTextureCoordinateElement* tce = 0;
00100     SbVec4f texCoord;  
00101     if ( useTexFunc ) tce = SoTextureCoordinateElement::getInstance(state);
00102     else 
00103     {
00104         texCoord[2] = 0.0;
00105         texCoord[3] = 1.0;
00106     }
00107 
00108     // We'll use this macro to make the code easier. It uses the
00109     // "point" variable to store the primitive vertex's point.
00110     SbVec3f  point;
00111     
00112 
00113         const int rows = 50; // Number of points per row
00114     const int columns = 50; // Number of points per column
00115     const int totalPoints = (rows)*(columns); // Total points in the grid
00116     
00117     float vertex[totalPoints][6];    
00118    
00119     int h = 0;
00120     double ui = 0;
00121         double vj = 0;
00122         
00123         double u_step = 1.0 /(double)(rows-1); // Size of the step in parameter u to go from 0 to 1 in the number of rows
00124         double v_step = 1.0 /(double)(columns-1); // Size of the step in parameter v to go from 0 to 1 in the number of columns
00125         
00126     for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++)
00127     {
00128         for ( int j = 0 ; j < columns ; j++ )
00129         {
00130                 vertex[h][0] = GetPoint3D(ui, vj).x;
00131                 vertex[h][1] = GetPoint3D(ui, vj).y;
00132                 vertex[h][2] = GetPoint3D(ui, vj).z;
00133                 vertex[h][3] = GetNormal(ui, vj)[0];
00134                 vertex[h][4] = GetNormal(ui, vj)[1];
00135                 vertex[h][5] = GetNormal(ui, vj)[2];
00136                 pv.setPoint(vertex[h][0], vertex[h][1], vertex[h][2] );
00137                 h++; //Increase h to the next point. 
00138                 vj += v_step; // Increase parameter vj to go from initial 0 to 1 at the end of the row (keep the same ui for the whole row)
00139         }
00140         vj = 0; // Re-initialize parameter vj to 0 in order to start from 0 in the next row
00141                 ui += u_step; // Increase parameter ui to go from initial 0 to 1 in the last row.
00142     }
00143 
00144         const int totalIndices  = (rows-1)*(columns-1)*4;
00145     int32_t* indices = new int32_t[totalIndices]; 
00146     int k = 0;
00147     for(int irow = 0; irow < (rows-1); irow++)
00148            for(int icolumn = 0; icolumn < (columns-1); icolumn++)
00149            {
00150                 indices[k] = irow*columns + icolumn;
00151                 indices[k+1] = indices[k] + 1;        
00152                 indices[k+3] = indices[k] + columns;        
00153                 indices[k+2] = indices[k+3] + 1;
00154     
00155                 k+=4; //Set k to the first point of the next face.
00156            }
00157            
00158     float finalvertex[totalIndices][6];
00159     for(int ivert = 0; ivert<totalIndices;ivert++)
00160     {
00161         finalvertex[ivert][0] = vertex[indices[ivert]][0];
00162         finalvertex[ivert][1] = vertex[indices[ivert]][1];
00163         finalvertex[ivert][2] = vertex[indices[ivert]][2];  
00164                 finalvertex[ivert][3] = vertex[indices[ivert]][3];
00165                 finalvertex[ivert][4] = vertex[indices[ivert]][4];
00166                 finalvertex[ivert][5] = vertex[indices[ivert]][5];
00167     }
00168     
00169 #define GEN_VERTEX(pv, x, y, z, s, t, normal)   \
00170      point.setValue( x,                         \
00171                      y,                         \
00172                      z);                        \
00173      if (useTexFunc)                            \
00174        texCoord = tce->get(point, normal);      \
00175      else {                                     \
00176        texCoord[0] = s;                         \
00177        texCoord[1] = t;                         \
00178      }                                          \
00179      pv.setPoint(point);                        \
00180      pv.setNormal(normal);                      \
00181      pv.setTextureCoords(texCoord);             \
00182      shapeVertex(&pv)
00183 
00184     
00185     float u = 1;
00186     float v = 1;  
00187         
00188         beginShape(action, QUADS );
00189     for( int i = 0; i < totalIndices; i++ )
00190     {
00191         //SbVec3f normal=GetNormal(finalvertex[i][0],finalvertex[i][1], finalvertex[i][2] );
00192         SbVec3f normal(finalvertex[i][3],finalvertex[i][4], finalvertex[i][5] );
00193         GEN_VERTEX(pv,  finalvertex[i][0], finalvertex[i][1],  finalvertex[i][2], u,  v, normal);
00194     }                   
00195     endShape();
00196 }
00197 
00198 bool TSquare::Intersect(const Ray& /*objectRay*/, double* /*tHit*/, DifferentialGeometry* /*dg*/) const 
00199 {
00200         return true;
00201 }
00202 
00203 bool TSquare::IntersectP( const Ray& objectRay ) const 
00204 {       
00205         return Intersect( objectRay, 0, 0 );
00206 }
00207 
00208 Point3D TSquare::Sample( double u, double v ) const
00209 {
00210         return GetPoint3D( u, v );
00211 }
00212 
00213 void TSquare::computeBBox(SoAction*, SbBox3f& box, SbVec3f& /*center*/ )
00214 {
00215         Point3D min = Point3D(-m_sideLength.getValue()/2,0.0, -m_sideLength.getValue()/2);
00216         Point3D max = Point3D(m_sideLength.getValue()/2,0.0,m_sideLength.getValue()/2);
00217         box.setBounds(SbVec3f( min.x, min.y, min.z ), SbVec3f( max.x, max.y, max.z ));
00218 }
00219 
00220 Point3D TSquare::GetPoint3D (double u, double v) const
00221 {
00222         if ((u < 0.0 && u > 1) && (v < 0.0 && v > 1))
00223         {
00224                 
00225                 tgf::SevereError("Function TSquare::GetPoint3D called with invalid parameters" );
00226         }
00227         
00228         double x = (u * m_sideLength.getValue()) - (m_sideLength.getValue()/2);
00229         double z = v * m_sideLength.getValue() - (m_sideLength.getValue()/2);
00230 
00231         return Point3D(x,0,z);
00232 }
00233 
00234 SbVec3f TSquare::GetNormal (double /*u*/, double /*v*/) const
00235 {
00236         return SbVec3f( 0, 1, 0);
00237 }
